feed.title: Event
feed.subtitle: All items in Space Schedule > Event.

entry.title: Crew-3 Crew Dragon Relocation
entry.content: NASA astronauts Raja Chari, Thomas Marshburn and Kayla Barron as well as ESA astronaut Matthias Maurer will relocate the Crew Dragon spacecraft to IDA-3 located at the zenith port of the Harmony module.

entry.title: NG-16 Cygnus Release & Reentry
entry.content: The Northrop Grumman NG-16 Cygnus will be unberthed from the ISS before initiating a destructive reentry into the Earth's atmosphere taking waste along with it.

entry.title: SpaceX Crew-2 "Endeavour" Crew Dragon Splashdown
entry.content: The "Endeavour" Crew Dragon will splashdown in the Gulf of Mexico, bringing NASA astronauts Shane Kimbrough and Megan McArthur, JAXA astronaut Akihiko Hoshide and ESA astronaut Thomas Pesquet back to Earth after spending six months on the International Space Station.

entry.title: SpaceX Crew-2 "Endeavour" Crew Dragon Undocking
entry.content: The "Endeavour" Crew Dragon will undock from the International Space Station, carrying NASA astronauts Shane Kimbrough and Megan McArthur, JAXA astronaut Akihiko Hoshide and ESA astronaut Thomas Pesquet. It will then reenter the Earth's atmosphere and splashdown in the Atlantic Ocean.

entry.title: SpaceX Crew-3 Crew Dragon Docking
entry.content: The Crew-3 Crew Dragon will dock autonomously to the International Space Station, carrying NASA astronauts Raja Chari, Thomas Marshburn and Kayla Barron as well as ESA astronaut Matthias Maurer to the International Space Station as crew members of Expedition 66.

entry.title: Progress MS-18 Docking
entry.content: The Progress MS-18 spacecraft is scheduled to autonomously dock to the Zvezda module of the ISS.

entry.title: Starship S20 Static Fire
entry.content: SpaceX is expected to attempt a static fire of the Starship S20 vehicle between 22:00 and 05:00 UTC (5pm - midnight CDT).

entry.title: Progress MS-17 Relocation
entry.content: The Progress MS-17 spacecraft will be relocated from the Poisk module to the Nauka module.

entry.title: FAA SpaceX Starship at Boca Chica Virtual Public Hearing #2
entry.content: Second of two virtual public hearings held by the FAA to discuss the Draft Environmental Assessment for the SpaceX Starship/Super Heavy program at the Boca Chica launch site in Cameron County, TX, USA. A free registration is required to attend the hearing.
